title: Is there a quota system for an international student in each university in the UK? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, generally the opposite. The UK governments (Education is a devolved issue) decide how much money they will give universities to support domestic students. So domestic places are limited. International students, on the other hand, are profitable for the universities so they generally want as many as they can get.

I don't think so. The London Business School, University of London is 91% international & EU. The London School of Economics is about 60% International. Imperial College London 66% international & EU. Some universities especially the low ranking ones don't have that many international students.
